TopicTitle: Hullow! Forum n00b but not a KSP n00b...

Articles.Content:
I spend a lot of time at r/ksp so some of you probably already know me. For the uninitiated to Reddit, these two videos represent my crowning achievement so far:

I'm currently in my SSTO phase and am in the middle of designing/testing a once-abandoned SSTO design that I'll call a "split decision" SSTO. Why "split decision?" Well, the 3-Kerbal command module is connected to the engine/wing cluster by large docking rings so that you can split them apart and throw a big, old orange fuel tank in-between for interplanetary flights.

I abandoned my first design because I made the middle, interplanetary add-on overly complex and she wagged like an excited puppy at throttle-up.

Welcome to the forums!

Nice work on getting out to Jool and its moons. Feel free to keep sharing your exploits, or to hop into any discussion that catches your fancy. You'll find that we're all big KSP enthusiasts here, so you should fit right in.
Welcome to the forums! Looks like you've had quite a bit of fun already.
I like how you used the music of Jupiter from The Planets for the Jool sequence. It's beautiful music and the perfect soundtrack to a mission to Jool.

I like how you used the music of Jupiter from The Planets for the Jool sequence. It's beautiful music and the perfect soundtrack to a mission to Jool.

Thanks! I daydreamed/composed that video for a good two months in my head. I've been a fan of Holst: The Planets for a long time and that piece instantly came to mind when I started figuring out how to do Jool missions .
